value.title: Northwestern University Has Developed An AI System That Helps Detect Covid-19 On Chest X-Rays
value.excerpt: Northwestern University researchers announced that they successfully created a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) radiology tool that can detect Covid-19 in chest x-rays. The study has since been published in the journal Radiology,

value.title: Ethical AI isn’t the same as trustworthy AI, and that matters
value.excerpt: Certainly, unethical systems create mistrust. It does not follow, however, that an ethical system will be categorically trusted.

value.title: SKT unveils its AI chip and new plans for AI semiconductor business

value.title: Aides’ Ties to Firms Present Biden With Early Ethics Test
value.excerpt: Some of the president-elect’s choices for top posts have done work for undisclosed corporate clients and aided a fund that invests in government contractors.

value.title: Emily Murphy, Administrator Of The GSA Shares Her Thoughts On AI
value.excerpt: Being recently thrust into the news, Emily Murphy, Administrator of the GSA might have rather been known for the impact she has helped make on the GSA's use of AI and automation to change the way the government procures and uses technology services.

value.title: Tesla could widen release of 'self-driving' software in two weeks
value.excerpt: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said on Friday there will probably be a wider roll out of a new "Full Self Driving" software update in two weeks.

value.excerpt: Video surveillance systems are increasing in power and value, as new ways to gather, analyze, share, and store digital data are developed.

value.title: Volvo thinks gaming tech can help make self-driving cars safer
value.excerpt: Volvo is using video game tech like VR headsets, simulations, and haptic feedback steering wheels to create a driving simulator to help make cars safer.

value.title: Health Startup Qure.ai Uses Artificial Intelligence to Help Find Abnormalities Relating to Covid-19
value.excerpt: Qure.ai, a healthtech start-up, has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) which can identify people at high-risk even before they reach the hospital. It can be used for contact tracing and remote triaging of Covid-19 patients.

value.title: 2021 will see the spread of AI and automation in the workplace
value.excerpt: Andy Watson, senior vice president for Asia, Pacific, Japan, and Greater China at SAP Concur, says many organizations will turn to automation and AI in 2021 as a way to address key business pain points and simplify cumbersome processes.

value.title: Another City Is Using Crime Control as an Excuse for Facial Recognition Surveillance
value.excerpt: Varanasi in India is installing 3,000 CCTV cameras with automated facial recognition tech at the city’s crossings.

value.title: TensorFlow Turns 5 - Five Reasons Why It Is The Most Popular ML Framework
value.excerpt: TensorFlow played a crucial role in the growth of machine learning and artificial intelligence. Thank you TensorFlow for enabling and empowering developers, and wish you a happy anniversary!

value.title: ECB’s Panetta Open to Case-by-Case Resumption of Bank Dividends
value.excerpt: European Central Bank Executive Board member Fabio Panetta said he’s open to allowing some banks to resume paying dividends as the economy improves.

value.title: China’s Industrial Profits Surge at Fastest Pace in Nine Years
value.excerpt: Profits at Chinese industrial enterprises surged at the fastest pace in a single month in almost nine years in October, a further sign the economic recovery is gathering pace.

value.title: Quotation of the Day: ‘Love Letter to Detroit,’ on Vellum and Chrome
value.excerpt: Quotation of the Day for Friday, November 27, 2020.

value.title: Bank of Canada says recent COVID-19 vaccine news is promising, recovery to be tough
value.excerpt: Recent news about coronavirus vaccines is promising even as cases continue to increase, Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said on Thursday, reiterating that the recovery would be tough.

value.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro says he will not take coronavirus vaccine
value.excerpt: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Thursday evening that he will not take a coronavirus vaccine, the latest in a series of statements he has made expressing skepticism toward coronavirus vaccination programs.
